metadata.name: We Are Alone Together #390
metadata.description:
We meander through the flows of life, alone but together. This experience ‚Äî an ultimately solitary one ‚Äî is communicated but never truly shared. Our consciousnesses live in a perpetual separated state, alone but together.

############

Display resolution scales with window size. Press ‚Äôh‚Äô (in live mode) to generate a 6000x7500 hi-res image. This may take a few seconds to generate depending on your hardware. Press ‚Äòd‚Äô to redraw the artwork.

Original artwork by perkwerk * made with p5.js * 2022

metadata.description:
A colourful graphic exploration that I started in December 2021 and didn't finish until just now. 
Happy birthday FX! #fxhashturnsone

metadata.name: Improvisation I #143
metadata.description:
‚ÄúImprovisation I‚Äú was born after my experiments with Fractal Brownian Motion. 

During random tweaks of colours, parameters and sizes I got something that really clicked with me ‚Äî a picture I wanted to get out of the code some time ago. 

Painterly looking curves and blots with subtle colours transitions create a calming picture, sometimes resembling outlines of a landscape.

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî

To change the size of an image, open it in live view and add ‚Äò&size=[size (6800 max.)]‚Äô to the end of the URL. 
Press [C] to load a clean version without grain.
Press [S] to save the image.

Created using p5.js and GLSL.
License: CC BY-NC-SA 4.0.

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî

hrunz. ‚Äî Oct. 2022.

metadata.name: BRTLSMBRTHDY #169
metadata.description:
Happy Brutalist birthday fxhash! A little Work In Progress turned into a quick sketch. Enjoy your ghost buildings.

All primary profits go to the Processing Foundation.

INSTRUCTIONS ::

(all of these will take a few moments)
h - Toggle high-res
t - toggle paper texture off
s - Download and save image

PRINTING INSTRUCTIONS ::

High-res will output a 8,192 x 8,192 image, at 300dpi it should print at...

27.3 x 27.3 inches
69.3 x 69.3 cm

metadata.name: Ichigo #215
metadata.description:
This generator is named 'Ichigo' (Ëã∫/ „ÅÑ„Å°„Åî), the Japanese word for 'strawberry'. 

Seeing each iteration from a suitable distance, small dots (to me, reminiscent of strawberry seeds) overlay different sequences of geometric repetitions, implying a sense of texture, grittiness and irregularity. 

By looking closer however, it becomes apparent to the viewer that the majority of the composition is in fact government by orderly elements, in this case grids of dots. 

This discovery invites the viewer to consider the output in front of them at different levels, near and far. At what point do you feel the dots begin to dissolve into a texture? When do you stop noticing the dots and instead begin to perceive the overall composition?

These questions are posed in a similar fashion as with meditation; at what point does something become something else? When does an in-breath become an out-breath and vice versa? 

Contemplation on simple questions like these can open a small portal into stillness and mindfulness by taking time to slowly observe our responses. 

23 palettes are included, each named after different areas of Tokyo. 

Press 'S' to download a full size 6000px x 6000px PNG output. 

As always, much gratitude and enjoy your piece.

metadata.name: Gestalt #394
metadata.description:
"Gestalt" is part of the fxhash interactive minting experience at The Ever-Evolving World of Art, Art Basel Hong-Kong, 2022

A flurry of many elements derived from my past (and future) strewn across a single canvas. As random as things seem, collectively time tends to reveal hints of order in the chaos. Sometimes, more is more.

Controls:
‚Ä¢ Left-click/tap reassembles the piece with one less element each time
‚Ä¢ 'R' reassembles the piece with all elements
‚Ä¢ 'S' saves the output

‚ÄúùöÉùöëùöé ùö†ùöëùöòùöïùöé ùöíùöú ùöêùöõùöéùöäùöùùöéùöõ ùöùùöëùöäùöó ùöùùöëùöé ùöúùöûùöñ ùöòùöè ùöíùöùùöú ùöôùöäùöõùöùùöú.‚Äù

Made in p5js
Created May 2022
Artist: @Yazid

metadata.name: Retrogrades #333
Agharta #137
metadata.description:
It may appear as an indecipherable map to some. To others, it may present itself as a cross section of an underground cave. Or maybe an uncanny landscape of volcanic activity, a diagram of geological strata, or even something else entirely. Some vague structure may also appear; is it the remains of an ancient civilization? Or perhaps a glimpse into our own tomorrow?

In "Agharta", I sought to create a generative work that could invite the viewer to explore the depths of their imagination and uncover hidden structures within the seemingly chaotic composition. The idea came to me when I was exploring Simplex noise and pixel displacement in Cables. I was surprised by the emergent structures that appeared when some set of parameters paired with the right texture. 

The title of the piece references the mythical underground world said to be located at the earth's core. This idea of hidden depths and secret worlds within the earth resonates with the abstract and enigmatic nature of the result generated by the noise. Imagery of landscape, vague structures, or geological features may appear but never stand out on its own; it exists in a state of constant flow and intersection as if viewed from another dimension. And just like the myth itself that bring up numerous theories that doesn‚Äôt necessarily connected to each other, it hints at that idea of an elusive imagined realm while never actually represent it completely.



=========

Controls:

[1] Set resolution to 716 x 1024px (default)

[2] Set resolution to 1433 x 2048px

[3] Set resolution to 2688 x 3840px

* The presets above are suitable for screen viewing up to 4k screen resolution. To set a custom resolution for printing and other purpose, add &res=[desired resolution] at the end of the URL. It will set the height of the image, and the width will be calculated automatically at 0.7 ratio. For example to get a resolution of 4911 x 7016px (about the size of A2 paper), add &res=7016 as URL parameter.

[Scroll/pinch] to zoom and drag to pan

[r] or [zoom out to max] Reset position

[c] Capture a screenshot of the current state at rendered resolution


Notes:

* This project use shaders that relies on GPU. Hi-res output may slow down your device. Since it also utilize GPU instance for thumbnail rendering, expect longer time for every iterations to be signed by fx(hash).

* If 'glitching' occurs or the composition behaves differently at different resolution, just refresh the page to reset it (except for the thin lines, which are always drawn at approximately 1 pixel, so expect it to vary at different resolution).

Made with cables.gl, a node-based webgl environment

XALTED 2022

objkt.name: In a Moment, a Thousand Years #159

metadata.name: In a Moment, a Thousand Years #159
metadata.description:
Fragmented time and fractured memories.

=========

Controls:

[1] set resolution to 716 x 1024px (default)
[2] set resolution to 1433 x 2048px
[3] set resolution to 2455 x 3508px (approx. the size of A4 paper)
[4] set resolution to 3472 x 4961px (approx. the size of A3 paper)
[5] set resolution to 4911 x 7016px (approx. the size of A2 paper)

[0] set resolution to current window size

[c] capture a screenshot at rendered resolution

*The higher resolution settings (3-5) can slow down your device, especially on a low-end laptop without a dedicated GPU. Use it only to render and download a hi-res output for printing. For screen viewing [1] or [2] is recommended.



Made with cables.gl, a node-based webgl environment

XALTED 2022

metadata.name: Millefoglie #43
metadata.description:
"A mille-feuille (French pronunciation: ‚Äã[mil f≈ìj], "thousand-sheets"), also known by the names Napoleon, vanilla slice, and custard slice, is a dessert made of puff pastry layered with pastry cream. Its modern form was influenced by improvements made by Marie-Antoine Car√™me.

Traditionally, a mille-feuille is made up of three layers of puff pastry (p√¢te feuillet√©e), alternating with two layers of pastry cream (cr√®me p√¢tissi√®re). The top pastry layer is finished in various ways: sometimes it is topped with whipped cream, or it may be dusted with icing sugar, cocoa, pastry crumbs, or sliced almonds. It may also be glazed with icing or fondant alone, or in alternating white (icing) and brown (chocolate) or other colored icing stripes, and combed to create a marbled effect." ‚Äî Wikipedia

Prints available upon request: prints@stefancontiero.com
Best enjoyed on browsers supporting Display-P3 color gamut.

License: CC BY-NC-ND 4.0

@stefan_contiero

metadata.name: NeoPrimal #337
metadata.description:
A story of (un)civilized Homosapiens trapped in a metropolitan nightmare, hoping to feel alive among all of the chaos..
------------------
Live-view_
Resolution: Add "&res=" end of your url with a resolution multiplier. (1-2-4) (Default:2=2400x3200px)
Press S: Saves the current scene.
LeftMouse: Controls the zoom level.
------------------
Created with p5.js

metadata.name: Artifice #93
metadata.description:
This series is is about playful obfuscation.

The fxtext article linked on the main profect goes more in-depth into what is meant by that, as well as the events that led to this collection.

5640 bytes of Vanilla JS with no libraries. Palettes make up a third of the code.

In live mode:
‚ÄòS‚Äô : save as png (3000‚Ää√ó‚Ää3600)
‚ÄôV‚Äô : save as svg (without grain)

URL params in live mode:
‚Äòg=n‚Äô : no grain
‚Äòg=p‚Äô : paper grain
‚Äòh=t‚Äô : high resolution mode, 9000‚Ää√ó10600 (Chrome only, and may take a moment)

For example, if you wanted paper grain in high resolution, append ‚Äú&g=p&h=t‚Äù to the url in live mode.

After rendering with these params, tapping 'P' will then save a png with those settings applied.

metadata.name: Influence no.1: Circular Expansion #116
metadata.description:
"Circular Expansion" is an abstract artwork focusing on the composition and connection of elements.
This is the first artwork from the "Influence" series. Similar to my emphasis on the importance of connections between small elements and larger elements in previous artworks, this series tries to show the connection and influence of elements on each other in a different and newer way by combining different algorithms and using multiple color palettes.
Various sizes and densities and 12 color palettes have been used.
--------
- Add &density=2-5 to the live view URL to render the image at higher resolution (Higher resolutions require more RAM space).

- Press ‚Äôs‚Äô on the live mode to save the artwork.

metadata.name: Handachak #81
metadata.description:
I have always been looking for solutions that can connect different visual elements in such a way as to create an integrated system and structure and each part of the work plays its own role in this system.
Another point is that always attributing physical characteristics to abstract forms creates aesthetic qualities. From a general point of view, one of these features is perspective, and in this project we see a type of perspective in an abstract and geometric structure.
"Handachak" means "Geometry" in ancient Persian.
